body: Maybe this is not a error the less code is correct but some text editors and Markdown renderers might automatically add a space after type and it does not affect the functionality of the code.

@haseeb196 But it doesn't take effect in Chrome when contains a space.
Seems the "style" is recognized as a function.

issue.title: Master container style fix for 4235
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for your interest in the project. I appreciate bugs filed and PRs submitted!
Please make sure that you are familiar with and follow the Code of Conduct for
this project (found in the CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md file).
Also, please make sure you're familiar with and follow the instructions in the
contributing guidelines (found in the CONTRIBUTING.md file).
If you're new to contributing to open source projects, you might find this free
video course helpful: http://kcd.im/pull-request
Please fill out the information below to expedite the review and (hopefully)
merge of your pull request!
-->

<!-- What changes are being made? (What feature/bug is being fixed here?) -->

**What**:

Fixes issue https://github.com/less/less.js/issues/4235

```style``` keyword would have invalid space after keyword in container queries.

<!-- Why are these changes necessary? -->

**Why**:

With the invalid space, the CSS is not parsed correctly by browsers.

<!-- Have you done all of these things?  -->

**Checklist**:

<!-- add "N/A" to the end of each line that's irrelevant to your changes -->
<!-- to check an item, place an "x" in the box like so: "- [x] Documentation" -->

- [ ] Documentation
- [x] Added/updated unit tests
- [x] Code complete

<!-- feel free to add additional comments -->

Tests passing locally. Updated one test case for container queries.

body: Sorry what? AFAIK, `@container [function]` is not valid, unless you can point to where it is.
@woody-li Ah, okay, your issue was written confusingly, because `type(` would be invalid. (I'm not sure why you didn't write `style(` in your example?) I see the `style(` reference now, my bad.

Sorry for my mistake, it should be `style`.
Thanks
How can I contribute to this issue?
How to contribute to this issue?
Any news on this? Safari 18 now supports container style queries as well, so would be nice to have this fix land in prod. Thnx!

FWIW, you can work around this issue by escaping the `style()` query:

```css
@container ( ~"style(--theme: light)" )
```

For `@` variables:

```css
@container ( ~"style(--theme: @{theme})" )
```

(you need the extra `( ... )` around the `style()` query or less will complain about them missing)
@matthew-dean The [release PR](https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/4280) has merged, could you help to release new version to npm.
